instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00426: What is 820-00426? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPVCC_S0_CPU: What is PPVCC_S0_CPU? The "PPVCC_S0_CPU" power rail is responsible for supplying power to the CPU when the MacBook is fully on, or in the S0 state. This rail is one of the main voltages that the CPU requires for operation. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00426</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Clean ME Please
threads.message:
Would someone be kind enough to clean the ME for me.

All rail voltages are present including <SIGNAL>PPVCC_S0_CPU</SIGNAL>. No liquid damage and I get fan spin. I'm suspecting there might be a problem with the BIOS/EFI but I don't have the means to clean the ME.

If needed they have Big Sur installed on the SSD and has been test on another MacBook.

Thank you in advance

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00426</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Clean ME Please
threads.message:
Try this as is, don't change serial number.
[URL unfurl="true"]https://drive.google.com/file/d/1I9DFTa8SjNCwq0YsdKmvaTT2lNtNmmmm/view?usp=sharing[/URL]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00426</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Clean ME Please
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00426</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Clean ME Please
threads.message: I just realized that it didn't upload as the file was too big. I've put it on MEGA

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00426</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Clean ME Please
threads.message:
Thanks, I've just stuck it in the cleaner just in case that sorts the problem out.

Question, does it make a difference which OS is installed for the ME to work correctly

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00426</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Clean ME Please
threads.message:
Clean ME region is automatically paired with the PCH, when board boots.
Doesn't matter if macOS is present on SSD, or USB support.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00426</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Clean ME Please
threads.message:
Well after cleaning the board in the Ultrasonic cleaner it started up.

The only problem I have now is it's working fine on the battery and mains but if the Macbook is shut down and I plug the magsafe in it boots up. Battery is charging and has only 120 cycles so not sure what could be causing this.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00426</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Clean ME Please
threads.message: Did you try shuting down the machine from macOS, by software?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00426</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Clean ME Please
threads.message: It ended up being my Magsafe cable which was faulty!!!
